task_summary: Detect and grasp the white plate, then move and place it onto the red plate, finally retreating.

task_long_description.overview: A 6-DoF robotic arm with a parallel gripper must pick up a white plate from a tabletop and place it onto a nearby red plate. The contact sheet shows approach, alignment, grasp, lift, transit toward the red plate, lowering to contact, release, and retreat. The behavior emphasizes reliable perception, stable grasping, gentle touchdown, and a short post-place retreat to avoid collisions with dishes.
preconditions: Workspace is clear around both plates
Robot is homed and gripper functional
White and red plates are on the table and visible or discoverable
stepwise_plan: Open gripper and approach above the white plate
Perceive the red plate and move above it
Lower until contact with the red plate surface
success_criteria: White plate is released centered on the red plate
Robot safely cleared from the dishes
failure_and_recovery: If perception fails, scan the workspace
If grasp unstable, reattempt pick after minor re-alignment
If contact not detected while placing, lower a bit more within safe depth, else abort
task_long_description.termination: Task ends after successful placement and final retreat or after an unrecoverable failure.

frame_3.now_evidence: Gripper is in contact with the white plate, indicating the grasp execution moment.
frame_3.predicts_next: Expect lift/retreat followed by transit toward the red plate.

task_instruction: Pick up a white plate, and then place it on the red plate.

node_specs.description: Compute grasp pose and store key.
Lift slightly after grasp or after placement.
Detect the red plate for placement.
Scan for the red plate if needed.
Transit and hover above red plate.
Lower to detect contact with the red plate.
Release the white plate onto the red plate.

recovery_strategy: Fallback to scanning when detection fails
Re-align and retry pick after unstable grasp
Increase lowering depth within safe limit if no contact
Abort and retreat on collision cues
assumptions: Frames show the white plate being grasped and then positioned near the red plate; final placement seems to occur by lowering and releasing. Exact pose centering is inferred; suction is not used; a top grasp is assumed.

expected_success_criteria: White plate resting on red plate
